text: S&P 500 futures slip after benchmark index hits fresh record: Live updates - CNBC

text: Electric vehicles had a bumpy road in 2025 — and one pleasant surprise - NPR

text: Teens are having disturbing interactions with chatbots. Here's how to lower the risks - NPR

text: Pipe bomb suspect told FBI he targeted U.S. political parties, memo says - NPR

text: Science history: Richard Feynman gives a fun little lecture — and dreams up an entirely new field of physics — Dec. 29, 1959 - Live Science
fullText: In a short talk at Caltech, physicist Richard Feynman laid out a vision of manipulating and controlling atoms at the tiniest scale. It would precede the field of nanotechnology by decades.
